creator: ritchey_49@hotmail.com
text:
It seems that the first 326761 are sent of the directory list only (though 
this is from some very unscientific testing, so this number may not be 
accurate).  If FancyIndexing is turned off, the complete directory listing is 
showed.

I don't think this is byte length... I think there is 'overload' 
  protection.  Everything that autoindex indexes is happening in memory
  (and it's more than simply a file name.)  IIRC, we set an upper bounds
  before we fall over.

  How many files are ordered in that directory before it falls down?
creator: wrowe@apache.org
ritchey_49@hotmail.com
text:
With a reboot of the computer after install, it works correctly.  However 
before the reboot restarting the server did nothing.
